newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares end higher, block deals dominate.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares end higher, block deals dominate.

text.p: The Singapore key share index ended higher on Friday with block deals driving the volume up, but trading was otherwise thin, dealers said.

Top active Goldtron saw a block deal of 15.30 million shares crossed between Singapore $0.915 and S$0.94. Inno-Pacific saw about 13 million shares crossed and Electro Resource saw about 13 million crossed.
The key Straits Times Industrials Index closed up 9.83 points at 2,126.27.
Market volume was a firm 148.19 million shares with 181 advances leading the declines by 181 to 136.
Commercial property stocks came under pressure earlier after Baring's call to "underweigh" the property sector, seeing a peak in demand for office space.
The Stock Exchange of Singapore Property Index recovered slightly at the close, up 0.38 points at 664.81.
Singapore Land was lower at noon, but ended unchanged at S$8.50. City Development was up S$0.20 at S$11.40.
Top gainer Singapore Press foreign rose S$0.40 to S$24.00. Bank stock OCBC foreign led the losers, falling S$0.20 to S$16.40.
